author: pawandhananjay
content: the issue is that none of the peers have data upto genesis. and there's currently no way of knowing in protocol that a peer that is "Synced" also has all the blocks before the weak subjectivity period. So lighthouse is asking peers for blocks, they are sending empty responses and sync isn't moving forward

author: pawandhananjay
content: also, nimbus seems to be sending empty responses instead of a ResourceUnavailable error for range requests

author: arnetheduck
content: empty is a correct response here

author: arnetheduck
content: there's no way to know this in general except by receiving a block from the peer (it could lie about being synced)

author: pawandhananjay
content: yeah i guess, but it doesn't help us when syncing from genesis atleast

author: pawandhananjay
content: specially if all peers are returning empty responses

author: arnetheduck
content: well, the action you take in this case is the same as if you received ResourceUnavailable, which is to use a different peer for the same range, so I'm not sure `ResourceUnavailable` would help you

author: arnetheduck
content: ie an empty response means "unknown" for that slot range - you have to confirm it with other means (for example receiving blocks "around" the range you requested that confirm that there were no blocks in that range in that history
